column5: MILAN  March 9 Italian broadcaster Mediaset  is in talks to sell its pay-TV unit to French media group Vivendi and a deal could be sealed soon  three sources close to the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: EXCLUSIVE-Teva set to win EU okay for $40.5 bln Allergan deal -sources

column4: Exclusive: Teva set to win EU okay for $40.5 billion Allergan deal - sources
column5: BRUSSELS Teva Pharmaceutical Industries  is expected to win EU antitrust approval for its $40.5 billion bid for Allergan's  generics unit after agreeing to sell off some of its products to appease regulators  three people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column5: BRUSSELS  March 9 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries  is expected to win EU antitrust approval for its $40.5 billion bid for Allergan's generics unit after agreeing to sell off some of its products to appease regulators  three people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Kerry says no pressing need for more US-Canada pipelines- CBC
column5: OTTAWA  March 9 The United States sees no urgent need for a new energy pipeline between Canada and the United States  U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said on Wednesday  in a broadcast interview ahead of a visit to Washington by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

column2: Transportadora De Gas Sa Ord B
column4: Argentina's TGS may refinance bonds if spreads move tighter
column5: BUENOS AIRES  March 9 (IFR) - Argentine gas distributor TGS can meet around US$240m in bond payments in coming years but may consider refinancing options if spreads keep pushing tighter  a source at the company told IFR.

column4: United Airlines faces board fight over poor performance
column5: Two investment funds with major stakes in United Continental Holdings Inc  launched a fight for control on Tuesday  proposing a slate of directors led by industry legend Gordon Bethune to shake up the board of the poorly performing airline. | Video

column5: Further company coverage:    ($1 = 32.8850 Taiwan dollars)   (Reporting by Hong Kong newsroom)

column4: UPDATE 3-Amazon to start air delivery network with leasing deal
column5: March 9 Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it had signed a deal to lease 20 Boeing 767 widebody freighter aircraft to handle more of its own deliveries in the United States.

column4: Valeant gives Pershing Square 1 board seat  adds 2 other directors
column5: Embattled Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc   said on Wednesday it has added a representative from shareholder Pershing Square Capital Management to its board of directors as well as two other new directors. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Valeant gives Pershing Square 1 board seat  adds 2 other directors
column5: March 9 Embattled Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  said on Wednesday it has added a representative from shareholder Pershing Square Capital Management to its board of directors as well as two other new directors.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX up with oil; energy  banking stocks  Valeant lead way
column5: TORONTO  March 9 Canada's main stock index gained on Wednesday  with bank and energy stocks up as the Bank of Canada held rates steady and oil prices rose  while Valeant  shares jumped after the drugmaker added an activist investor to its board.

column4: Valeant gives Pershing Square a seat on its board
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc    under scrutiny for its accounting and business practices  said it had given shareholder Pershing Square Capital Management a seat on its board and added two additional directors.

column4: Valeant gives Pershing Square a seat on its board
column5: March 9 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc   under scrutiny for its accounting and business practices  said it had given shareholder Pershing Square Capital Management a seat on its board and added two additional directors.

column4: Valeant to appoint three new directors as soon as Wednesday: sources
column5: NEW YORK Embattled drug company Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  whose stock price has tumbled 38 percent this year  will appoint three new board members as soon as Wednesday  people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

column4: Fund manager Ackman calls Valeant 'very valuable asset'
column5: NEW YORK Billionaire investor Bill Ackman on Tuesday called embattled drug company Valeant Pharmaceuticals a "very valuable asset" but forecast that if the company's situation does not stabilize soon new management will be brought in or the company will be sold.

column4: UPDATE 2-Fund manager Ackman calls Valeant 'very valuable asset'
column5: NEW YORK  March 8 Billionaire investor Bill Ackman on Tuesday called embattled drug company Valeant Pharmaceuticals a "very valuable asset" but forecast that if the company's situation does not stabilize soon new management will be brought in or the company will be sold.

column4: ETE makes private offering to help pay for Williams deal
column5: NEW YORK  March 9 Energy Transfer Equity   which is in the process of buying rival pipeline company Williams Companies Inc  said it carried out a private offering of convertible shares to some of its investors in order to help pay for the deal.

column4: UPDATE 3-Head of Argentina's YPF resigns in government restructuring
column5: BUENOS AIRES  March 9 The head of Argentina's state-controlled oil firm  YPF  is resigning amid a purge by the country's new president  Mauricio Macri  of top officials associated with the former leftist government.

column4: Argentina's YPF hires banks for international bond
column5: BUENOS AIRES  March 9 (IFR) - Argentine oil company YPF has mandated banks on a US$500m bond sale  a market source told IFR on Wednesday  as the country's borrowers make their way back to the capital markets.

column4: Argentina asks boss of state-run oil company YPF to resign-report
column5: BUENOS AIRES  March 9 Argentina has asked the head of state-controlled oil company YPF to step down next month  the government's official news agency Telam said on Wednesday.

column4: Thai Minor International to invest more than $1 bln in hotels  fast food over 5 yrs
column5: BANGKOK  March 9 Thailand's Minor International Pcl plans to invest 40 billion baht ($1.13 billion) over the next five years in a major  expansion of its hotel and fast-food chain businesses at home and overseas  a senior executive said on Wednesday.

column4: New Gold hedges nearly all remaining 2016 gold output
column5: NEW YORK  March 9 New Gold Inc has hedged nearly all of its remaining 2016 gold production to ensure cash flow for its Rainy River project  the company said  an unusually large amount for a miner after bullion made its biggest rally in 4-1/2 years.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Futures higher as oil prices rise
column5: March 9 Canada's main stock index was set to open higher on Wednesday after oil prices held above $40 a barrel on speculation that the world's largest exporters could agree this month to freeze production.
